p: Doxycycline (DOX) is a semisynthetic tetracycline antibiotic that prevents bacterial protein synthesis by acting on ribosomes (30S subunit) [ 167, 172, 173, 174, 175]. DOX, widely used alone or in combination with quinine for chemoprophylaxis in CQ-resistant P. falciparum cases of malaria [ 176], has been shown to exert inhibitory effects against different microbial infections.
